TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed TransactionManager extends System.Object
public ref class TransactionManager abstract sealed

Docs.summary: Contains methods used for transaction management. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This class contains static properties and methods used to obtain information about the default transaction options. It also contains several static methods used for recovery of a durable resource when the durable resource fails. No special action is required of a durable resource if the Microsoft Distributed Transaction Coordinator (MSDTC) fails.

MemberSignature.Value: public static TimeSpan DefaultTimeout { get; }
.property valuetype System.TimeSpan DefaultTimeout
Public Shared ReadOnly Property DefaultTimeout As TimeSpan
public: static property TimeSpan DefaultTimeout { TimeSpan get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the default timeout interval for new transactions.
Docs.value: A value that specifies the timeout interval for new transactions.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The timeout interval of a transaction is the time within which the transaction must be completed. If the transaction manager has not heard from all transaction participants within the timeout interval, it aborts the transaction.
This value can be set in the `DefaultSettingsSection` of the config file.

MemberSignature.Value: public static event System.Transactions.TransactionStartedEventHandler DistributedTransactionStarted;
.event class System.Transactions.TransactionStartedEventHandler DistributedTransactionStarted
Public Shared Custom Event DistributedTransactionStarted As TransactionStartedEventHandler
public: static event System::Transactions::TransactionStartedEventHandler ^ DistributedTransactionStarted;

Docs.summary: Indicates that a distributed transaction has started.

remarks.format:
## Remarks **Caution** Signing up for this event degrades the performance of all distributed transactions. Local transactions are not monitored as performance is affected even more.
**Note** This method uses <xref:System.Security.Permissions.SecurityAction.LinkDemand> to prevent it from being called from untrusted code; however, only the immediate caller is required to possess the `FullTrust` permission set.

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.Transactions.HostCurrentTransactionCallback HostCurrentCallback { get; set; }
.property class System.Transactions.HostCurrentTransactionCallback HostCurrentCallback
Public Shared Property HostCurrentCallback As HostCurrentTransactionCallback

public: static property System::Transactions::HostCurrentTransactionCallback ^ HostCurrentCallback { System::Transactions::HostCurrentTransactionCallback ^ get(); void set(System::Transactions::HostCurrentTransactionCallback ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a custom transaction factory.
Docs.value: A that contains a custom transaction factory.

remarks.format: ## Remarks **Note** This method uses <xref:System.Security.Permissions.SecurityAction.LinkDemand> to prevent it from being called from untrusted code; however, only the immediate caller is required to possess the `FullTrust` permission set.

MemberSignature.Value: public static TimeSpan MaximumTimeout { get; }
.property valuetype System.TimeSpan MaximumTimeout
Public Shared ReadOnly Property MaximumTimeout As TimeSpan
public: static property TimeSpan MaximumTimeout { TimeSpan get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the default maximum timeout interval for new transactions.
Docs.value: A value that specifies the maximum timeout interval that is allowed when creating new transactions.

remarks.format:
## Remarks For an explanation of the timeout interval, see the documentation for the <xref:System.Transactions.TransactionManager.DefaultTimeout%2A> property.
This value can be set in the `MachineSettingsSection` of the config file.

public: static void RecoveryComplete(Guid resourceManagerIdentifier);
public static void RecoveryComplete (Guid manager);
.method public static hidebysig void RecoveryComplete(valuetype System.Guid manager) cil managed
Public Shared Sub RecoveryComplete (manager As Guid)
public: static void RecoveryComplete(Guid manager);

Docs.summary: Notifies the transaction manager that a resource manager recovering from failure has finished reenlisting in all unresolved transactions.

remarks.format:
## Remarks All durable resource managers should do recovery when they first start up by calling the <xref:System.Transactions.TransactionManager.Reenlist%2A> method for each outstanding transaction. Only when all of the reenlistments are done should the resource manager call <xref:System.Transactions.TransactionManager.RecoveryComplete%2A>.
For more information on recovery, see [Performing Recovery](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/d342c5c7-da64-4a4c-8e63-b52f4fbf2691).
**Note** This method uses <xref:System.Security.Permissions.SecurityAction.LinkDemand> to prevent it from being called from untrusted code; however, only the immediate caller is required to possess the `FullTrust` permission set.
